history.content: Can't answer your second question regarding double majoring, but Data 100 workload is roughly around the same amount as 61A. Weekly/biweekly homeworks iirc and a few projects which can each take anywhere from a 2-8 hours depending on your ability. The homeworks and projects are a lot more straightforward than in 61A as well, so you'll spend less time figuring out how to solve the problems and more time actually solving them. It's definitely the easiest upper div CS class I took during my time (also took 161, 162, 168, 170, 186, and 188 for reference), so I would say it's a nice transition into the other upper divs within the department.

How much time could I expect to spend on Data 100/week (outside of the lectures)?

I breezed through Data 8 (A+) and the probability portion of CS 70, but I struggled in 61A (B) and the programming parts in some Data 8 projects were relatively challenging for me.

Also, it is possible to double major in Data Science with EECS?
history.subject: Data 100 workload
